thread.title: Here’s The TRUTH About The Women’s March Liberals Hope You Don’t See…
thread.title_full: Here’s The TRUTH About The Women’s March Liberals Hope You Don’t See…

author: Nickarama
title: Here’s The TRUTH About The Women’s March Liberals Hope You Don’t See…
text:
10:25pm January 23, 2017 Do you like this article? 
In looking at the crowd at the Women’s March in Washington, D.C., President Donald Trump asked “where were they during the vote?” As we noted, many did not actually vote. 
But there’s another point about the Women’s Marches on Saturday that’s been missed by many in media. 
We touched on it in a prior post, but here’s some more evidence to back it up. 
As Five Thirty Eight reports, most of the women marching were from states which Hillary Clinton won. 
As Five Thirty Eight notes, the marches looked a lot like the Clinton coalition. 
Specifically, about 80 percent of march attendance came in states that Clinton won. By comparison, only slightly more than half of Clinton’s voters were in these states. 
More: 
Only 11 percent of marchers, by contrast, were in a key group of swing states — those that Obama won in 2008 or 2012 but which Clinton lost in 2016. (These states are Florida, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Michigan, Wisconsin, Iowa and Indiana.) Some 25 percent of tea party protesters on April 15, 2009, were in these swing states, by contrast. 
What does this mean? 
It means that most of the women in the march the women are still for Clinton and anti-Trump. 
Also that other women in red states and swing state did not in the main come out for the anti-Trump fest. 
It wasn’t a “Women’s March” as much as it was a Democratic Coalition march. LIKE this article?
